name: Avoid unused local variables (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all the artifacts with unused variables.
A violation is detected when a local variable is declared and/or assigned and not used.
output:
This report lists all artifacts with unused variables.

This QR provides the following information:
Artifact full name.
rationale: For readability and usability reasons, artifacts should not have unused variables. For more complex types, such as class, having unused variables would cost resources.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of unused variables.
remediationSample:
<?php
function getSomething() {
   echo "removed unused variable", PHP_EOL;       //violation removed
}
class CastTest {  
 public function doSomething() {
   $unusedVariable3 = 20; 
   echo $unusedVariable3;     //  violation removed
 }
}
getSomething();
$obj = new CastTest();
$obj->doSomething();
?>
sample:
<?php
function getSomething() {
   $unusedVariable2 = 15 ;  //violation
}
class CastTest {  
 public function doSomething() {
 $unusedVariable3 = 20; // violation
 }
}
getSomething();
$obj = new CastTest();
$obj->doSomething();
?>
